description:
Baremetal deploy helper will fail with the below error if the flavor root_mb is exactly equal to the disk size, because sfdisk is leading with 1MB (to compensate for a bug in ubuntu raring). Simple work around is for flavor root_mb to be smaller than physical disk; this will work if root_mb is much smaller, or if it is just 1MB smaller, than the disk. Another solution would be to deduct 1MB from root_mb when partitioning.

===========================

2013-04-22 17:25:57,992.992 28920 ERROR nova.virt.baremetal.deploy_helper [-] Cmd     : sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf sfdisk -uM /dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.
0.2.67:3260-iscsi-iqn-eabc30c7-7161-4824-a3c3-cea2ddb1cecb-lun-1
2013-04-22 17:25:57,993.993 28920 ERROR nova.virt.baremetal.deploy_helper [-] StdOut  : 
Disk /dev/disk/by-path/ip-192.0.2.67:3260-iscsi-iqn-eabc30c7-7161-4824-a3c3-cea2ddb1cecb-lun-1: 10240 cylinders, 64 heads, 32 sectors/track

title: Nonobvious cause for error when baremetal flavor root_mb == disk size

Baremetal deploy helper will fail with the below error if the flavor root_mb is exactly equal to the disk size, because sfdisk is leading with 1MB (to compensate for a bug in ubuntu raring). Simple work around is for flavor root_mb to be smaller than physical disk; this will work if root_mb is much smaller, or if it is just 1MB smaller, than the disk. Another solution would be to deduct 1MB from root_mb when partitioning.

comments.content:
I think the failure isn't a bug: root_mb needs to be <= 
disk_size + partition table overheads (both size, slack space and rounding requirements) + swap size

What *is* the bug though is that the error is opaque.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lifeless

comments.content:
and that the expectation isn't clear.

I'm comfortable saying that the bug is in the opaqueness of the error, and that we should call out this expectation in the docs as well.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~devananda

comments.content: I'm removing the tripleo task : this doesn't affect the ability to do the tripleo story any more than similar low impact corner cases elsewhere in nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~lifeless

comments.content:
This could be overcome as follows:

Nova-scheduler provide the disk_filter with following option in /etc/nova/nova.conf:
disk_allocation_ratio = 1.0.

By modifying this option to consider the calculation mentioned by Rober Collins, this issue could be identified in the scheduler level it self, there by scheduler will not select the node which does not have enough memory.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~kanagaraj-manickam
